Title: Venture Global to supply Ukraine’s DTEK with LNG volumes starting this year
Description: US-based LNG project developer Venture Global has penned a comprehensive heads of agreement with Ukrainian private energy company DTEK for the supply of LNG to Ukraine and Eastern Europe starting this year. The agreement also provides for long-term LNG offtake from the proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG plant.
Author: JS

Title: Installation of second FSRU jetty works start at Wilhelmshaven LNG
Description: Norwegian energy equipment and solution player ECOonnect Energy said it has initiated the installation of the jettyless ready IQuay solution for LNG import to Wilhelmshaven, Germany, ahead of the Excelsior floating storage regasification unit’s deployment in the second half of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Saudi Aramco inks term LNG offtake agreement from NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG
Description: State-owned Saudi Aramco has inked a non-binding heads of agreement with US-based LNG project developer NextDecade to offtake 1.2 mtpa of LNG from Train 4 of the proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG plant in Brownsville, Texas for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Bangladesh’s Summit LNG FSRU undocks from terminal, seen heading to Seatrium in Singapore for repairs
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit has undocked from the Summit LNG terminal off the coast of Moheshkhali island in Bangladesh and is expected to sail to the Seatrium Tuas shipyard in Singapore for repairs following the damage it sustained during a storm at the end of May.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh Galleon signals its imminent arrival at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna LNG import terminal
Description: The 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit has signalled its imminent arrival at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna LNG terminal where it will serve as the country’s LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone Platform repairs to be completed in “coming weeks”; LNG production restart to follow
Description: Repairs on the fuel gas system of Chevron’s Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have begun and are expected to be completed in the coming weeks, with the restart of LNG and domestic gas production to follow.
Author: CK

Title: Alexandroupolis LNG terminal undergoes more commissioning tests, further delaying commercial start
Description: Commissioning activities are still underway at the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis Independent Natural Gas System LNG terminal in Greece, about four months after the receipt of an LNG commissioning cargo as the plant’s operator, Gastrade, conducts further commissioning tests, delaying the start of commercial operations.
Author: CK
